paragraphs: LAN-Cam is a LAN-only camera and screen streaming tool that broadcasts to multiple devices on the same Wi-Fi with low latency and zero internet dependency. By keeping traffic local, it avoids cloud lag, bandwidth bills, and privacy concerns.

It is built for classrooms, small offices, and at-home setups that need quick sharing without cloud complexity—simple discovery, QR/PIN joins, and a frictionless viewer keep the focus on the content. Broadcasters can switch between screen or webcam modes in seconds.

Admins get predictable performance because the signalling layer is lightweight and can run entirely on-prem. Diagnostics, quality presets, and optional PIN/locks make it practical for teachers, trainers, and demo rooms that need a reliable local broadcast.
bullets: Screen or webcam mode with quality presets and optional audio for lessons or demos.
Auto-discovery on LAN with URL/QR/PIN fallback when networks are locked down.
Browser viewer with full-screen mode, latency indicator, and responsive layout.
Session controls for named rooms, PIN/locks, and basic viewer stats.
Local-first architecture with lightweight signalling that can stay on-prem or a small VPS.
